description: Strings that look like secrets or PII but aren't — should NOT be flagged

samples.text: The function returns AKIAEXAMPLE which is a test constant, not a real key
samples.reason: AKIAEXAMPLE is only 11 chars, real AWS keys are AKIA + 16 chars

samples.text: Use the pattern 123-45-6789 as a placeholder in documentation
samples.note: This IS a valid SSN pattern — the system should flag it. Context scoring may lower confidence.

samples.text: The error code is E-1234567890 which follows our internal format
samples.reason: Internal error code format, not a real identifier
Code snippet containing hash function — no actual secrets

samples.text: The regex pattern is \b\d{3}-\d{2}-\d{4}\b which matches SSN format
samples.reason: Regex pattern describing SSN format, not an actual SSN

samples.text: Version 1.2.3.4 of the library was released yesterday
samples.reason: Version number looks like IP address but isn't

samples.text: The test uses password = 'test' as a fixture value
samples.reason: Password value 'test' is only 4 chars, below minimum length threshold

samples.text: Set RUST_LOG=debug to enable verbose logging
samples.reason: Environment variable assignment but not a secret — 'debug' is a log level
UUID format, not a secret or PII

expected_output.description: The sanitizer should have low false positive rate on code, config, and documentation text
